snippet: I.B.M. has designed a new operations center for the city of Rio de Janeiro, coordinating all kinds of functions under one roof. The company hopes the project will lead to a huge worldwide business.
abstract: International Business Machines has designed a new operations center for Rio de Janeiro, integrating data from about 30 agencies under one roof; company hopes the project will lead to a huge worldwide business, raising its annual revenue to $150 billion or more, from $107 billion in 2011; market to supply cities with 'smart' systems is expected to reach $57 billion by 2014.
lead_paragraph: I.B.M. has designed a new operations center for the city of Rio de Janeiro, coordinating all kinds of functions under one roof. The company hopes the project will lead to a huge worldwide business.

headline.seo: I.B.M. Takes ‘Smarter Cities’ Concept to Rio de Janeiro
